description:
I was not happy with the recent picture of M31. Although I was able to collect a decent amount of subs it turned out very noisy and there was a lack of detail. The sky seemed clear during that time but I think there was haze or invisible cirrus clouds.

Last night I visited M31 again, this time the subs look much better. Also the final result is much more appealing. I am happy with that but, as always, more subs would have been better...

Thanks to a fellow Astrobin Member (Frank - http://www.astrobin.com/users/zishor) I am using APT instead of Backyard EOS. I am totally convinced by the plate solving: You let APT take a picture, plate solve it and it will slew automatically to the object you choose... it almost feels like cheating. No time lost with aligning the mount and taking a lot of framing shots. Perfect! :)

Best,
Jan
imaging_telescopes: William Optics GTF 81 Five Element APO
title: M31 with 535 mm - second try
